intro: Allosorus crispus var. acrostichoides, commonly known as the golden groundsel, is a flowering plant native to the eastern United States. It is characterized by its yellow flowers and fuzzy, lobed leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. The plant typically grows in moist, open habitats such as meadows and woodland edges. It belongs to the sunflower family (Asteraceae) and produces seeds that are dispersed by wind. Its botanical features make it a distinctive and recognizable species within its native range.
